intro: Cacalia delphiniifolia var. tebakoensis, commonly known as the Tebako's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features slender, hairy stems and heart-shaped, serrated leaves that are typically covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are small and blue to purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variant is noted for its resilience to cold climates and is often found in rocky, alpine environments.
